name: src/ZingTouch.js
ZingTouch
description:
The global API interface for ZingTouch. Contains a constructor for the Region Object,
and constructors for each predefined Gesture.

name: src/core/arbiter.js
arbiter
description:
Function that handles event flow, negotiating with the interpreter, and dispatcher.
1. Receiving all touch events in the window.
2. Determining which gestures are linked to the target element.
3. Negotiating with the Interpreter what event should occur.
4. Sending events to the dispatcher to emit events to the target.

params.name: event
params.description: The event emitted from the window object.

params.name: region
params.description: The region object of the current listener.

name: src/core/classes/Binder.js
Binder
description:
A chainable object that contains a single element to be bound upon.
Called from ZingTouch.bind(), and is used to chain over gesture callbacks.

name: constructor
description: Constructor function for the Binder class.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} - Returns 'this' to be chained over and over again.

params.name: element
params.description: The element to bind gestures to.

params.name: bindOnce
params.description: Option to bind once and only emit the event once.

params.name: state
params.description: The state of the Region that is being bound to.

return.description: Returns 'this' to be chained over and over again.

name: element
description: The element to bind gestures to.

name: src/core/classes/Binding.js
Binding
description: Responsible for creating a binding between an element and a gesture.

name: constructor
description: Constructor function for the Binding class.

params.name: element
params.description: The element to associate the gesture to.

params.name: gesture
params.description: A instance of the Gesture type.

params.name: handler
params.description:
The function handler to execute when a gesture is recognized
on the associated element.

params.name: capture
params.description:
A boolean signifying if the event is to be emitted during
the capture or bubble phase.

params.name: bindOnce
params.description: A boolean flag used for the bindOnce syntax.

name: element
description: The element to associate the gesture to.

name: gesture
description: A instance of the Gesture type.

name: handler
description: The function handler to execute when a gesture is recognized on the associated element.

name: capture
description: A boolean signifying if the event is to be emitted during the capture or bubble phase.

name: bindOnce
description: A boolean flag used for the bindOnce syntax.

name: src/core/classes/Input.js
Input
description:
Tracks a single input and contains information about the current, previous, and initial events.
Contains the progress of each Input and it's associated gestures.

name: constructor
description: Constructor function for the Input class.

params.name: event
params.description: The Event object from the window

params.name: identifier
params.description:
The identifier for each input event
(taken from event.changedTouches)

name: initial
description: Holds the initial event object. A touchstart/mousedown event.

name: current
description:
Holds the most current event for this Input, disregarding any other past, current, and
future events that other Inputs participate in. e.g. This event ended in an 'end' event,
but another Input is still participating in events -- this will not be updated in such cases.

name: previous
description: Holds the previous event that took place.

name: identifier
description: Refers to the event.touches index, or 0 if a simple mouse event occurred.

name: progress
description: Stores internal state between events for each gesture based off of the gesture's id.

name: update
description: Receives an input, updates the internal state of what the input has done next.

params.name: event
params.description: The event object to wrap with a ZingEvent.

params.name: touchIdentifier
params.description: The index of inputs (usually from event.touches)

name: getGestureProgress
description: Returns the progress of the specified gesture.

unknown.tagValue:
{Object} - The progress of the gesture. Creates an empty object if no progress
has begun.

params.name: id
params.description: The identifier for each unique Gesture's progress.

return.description:
The progress of the gesture. Creates an empty object if no progress
has begun.

name: getCurrentEventType
description: Returns the normalized current Event's type.

unknown.tagValue: {String} The current event's type ( start | move | end )

return.description: The current event's type ( start | move | end )

name: resetProgress
description: Resets a progress/state object of the specified gesture.

params.name: id
params.description: The identifier of the specified gesture

name: src/core/classes/Region.js
Region
description:
Allows the user to specify a region to capture all events to feed ZingTouch into. This can be as narrow as
the element itself, or as big as the document itself. The more specific an area, the better performant the
overall application will perform. Contains API methods to bind/unbind specific elements
to corresponding gestures. Also contains the ability to register/unregister new gestures.

name: constructor
description: Constructor function for the Region class.

params.name: element
params.description: The element to capture all window events in that region to feed into ZingTouch.

params.name: capture
params.description: Whether the region listens for captures or bubbles.

params.name: preventDefault
params.description: Whether the default browser functionality should be disabled;

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the region, assigned by the ZingTouch object.

name: id
description:
The identifier for the Region. This is assigned by the ZingTouch object and is used to hash gesture ids
for uniqueness.

name: element
description: The element being bound to.

name: capture
description: Whether the region listens for captures or bubbles.

name: preventDefault
description: Boolean to disable browser functionality such as scrolling and zooming over the region

name: state
description: The internal state object for a Region. Keeps track of registered gestures, inputs, and events.

name: bind
description: Bind an element to a registered/unregistered gesture with multiple function signatures.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} - a chainable object that has the same function as bind.

params.name: element
params.description: The element object.

params.name: gesture
params.description: Gesture key, or a Gesture object.

params.name: handler
params.description: The function to execute when an event is emitted.

params.name: capture
params.description: capture/bubble

params.name: bindOnce
params.description: = false] - Option to bind once and only emit the event once.

return.description: a chainable object that has the same function as bind.

name: bindOnce
description:
Bind an element and sets up actions to remove the binding once it has been emitted
for the first time.
1. bind(element) - chainable
2. bind(element, gesture, handler, [capture])

unknown.tagValue: {Object} - a chainable object that has the same function as bind.

params.name: element
params.description: The element object.

params.name: gesture
params.description: Gesture key, or a Gesture object.

params.name: handler
params.description: The function to execute when an event is emitted.

params.name: capture
params.description: capture/bubble

return.description: a chainable object that has the same function as bind.

name: unbind
description: Unbinds an element from either the specified gesture or all if no element is specified.

unknown.tagValue: {Array} - An array of Bindings that were unbound to the element;

params.name: element
params.description: The element to remove.

params.name: gesture
params.description: A String representing the gesture, or the actual object being used.

return.description: An array of Bindings that were unbound to the element;

name: register
description: Registers a new gesture with an assigned key

params.name: key
params.description: The key used to register an element to that gesture

params.name: gesture
params.description: A gesture object

name: unregister
description:
Un-registers a gesture from the Region's state such that it is no longer emittable.
Unbinds all events that were registered with the type.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} - The Gesture object that was unregistered or null if it could not be found.

params.name: key
params.description: Gesture key that was used to register the object

return.description: The Gesture object that was unregistered or null if it could not be found.

name: src/core/classes/State.js
findInputById
description:
Searches through each input, comparing the browser's identifier key for touches, to the stored one
in each input

unknown.tagValue: {Input} - The input object with the corresponding identifier, null if it did not find any.

params.name: inputs
params.description: The array of inputs in state.

params.name: identifier
params.description: The identifier the browser has assigned.

return.description: The input object with the corresponding identifier, null if it did not find any.

name: State
description:
Creates an object related to a Region's state, and contains helper methods to update and clean up different
states.

name: constructor
description: Constructor for the State class.

name: regionId
description: The id for the region this state is bound to.

name: inputs
description: An array of current and recently inactive Input objects related to a gesture.

name: bindings
description: An array of Binding objects; The list of relations between elements, their gestures, and the handlers.

name: numGestures
description: The number of gestures that have been registered with this state

name: registeredGestures
description: A key/value map all the registered gestures for the listener. Note: Can only have one gesture registered to one key.

name: addBinding
description:
Creates a new binding with the given element and gesture object.
If the gesture object provided is unregistered, it's reference will be saved in as a binding to
be later referenced.

params.name: element
params.description: The element the gesture is bound to.

params.name: gesture
params.description:
Either a name of a registered gesture, or an unregistered
 Gesture object.

params.name: handler
params.description:
The function handler to be called when the event is emitted.
Used to bind/unbind.

params.name: capture
params.description:
Whether the gesture is to be detected in the capture of bubble
phase. Used to bind/unbind.

params.name: bindOnce
params.description: Option to bind once and only emit the event once.

name: retrieveBindingsByElement
description: Retrieves the Binding by which an element is associated to.

unknown.tagValue: {Array} - An array of Bindings to which that element is bound

params.name: element
params.description: The element to find bindings to.

return.description: An array of Bindings to which that element is bound

name: retrieveBindingsByInitialPos
description:
Retrieves all bindings based upon the initial X/Y position of the inputs.
e.g. if gesture started on the correct target element, but diverted away into the correct region,
this would still be valid.

unknown.tagValue: {Array} - An array of Bindings to which that element is bound

return.description: An array of Bindings to which that element is bound

name: updateInputs
description: Updates the inputs with new information based upon a new event being fired.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} - returns true for a successful update, false if the event is invalid.

params.name: event
params.description: The event being captured

params.name: regionElement
params.description: The element where this current Region is bound to.

return.description: returns true for a successful update, false if the event is invalid.

name: resetInputs
description: Removes all inputs from the state, allowing for a new gesture.

name: numActiveInputs
description: Counts the number of active inputs at any given time.

return.description: The number of active inputs.

name: registerGesture
description: Register the gesture to the current region.

params.name: gesture
params.description: The gesture to register

params.name: key
params.description: The key to define the new gesture as.

name: assignGestureId
description:
Tracks the gesture to this state object to become uniquely identifiable.
Useful for nested Regions.

params.name: gesture
params.description: The gesture to track

name: src/core/classes/ZingEvent.js
ZingEvent
description: An event wrapper that normalizes events across browsers and input devices

params.name: event
params.description: The event object being wrapped.

params.name: event.touches
params.description: The number of touches on a screen (mobile only).

params.name: event.changedTouches
params.description:
The TouchList representing points that
participated in the event.

params.name: touchIdentifier
params.description: The index of touch if applicable

name: originalEvent
description: The original event object.

name: type
description: The type of event or null if it is an event not predetermined.

name: x
description: The X coordinate for the event, based off of the client.

name: y
description: The Y coordinate for the event, based off of the client.

name: pageX
description: The pageX coordinate for the event

name: pageY
description: The pageY coordinate for the event

name: screenX
description: The screenX coordinate for the event

name: screenY
description: The screenY coordinate for the event

name: src/core/dispatcher.js
emitEvent
description: Emits the new event. Unbinds the event if the event was registered at bindOnce.

params.name: target
params.description: Element object to emit the event to.

params.name: event
params.description: The CustomEvent to emit.

params.name: binding
params.description: An object of type Binding

name: dispatcher
description:
Emits data at the target element if available, and bubbles up from the target to the parent
until the document has been reached. Called from the arbiter.

params.name: binding
params.description: An object of type Binding

params.name: data
params.description: The metadata computed by the gesture being emitted.

params.name: events
params.description: An array of ZingEvents, corresponding to the inputs on the screen.

name: src/core/interpreter.js
interpreter
description:
Receives an event and an array of Bindings (element -> gesture handler) to determine
what event will be emitted. Called from the arbiter.

unknown.tagValue:
{Object | null} - Returns an object containing a binding and metadata,
or null if a gesture will not be emitted.

params.name: bindings
params.description:
An array containing Binding objects that associate the
element to an event handler.

params.name: event
params.description: The event emitted from the window.

params.name: state
params.description: The state object of the current listener.

return.description:
Returns an object containing a binding and metadata,
or null if a gesture will not be emitted.

name: src/core/main.js
src/core/util.js

unknown.tagValue:
util.js
Various accessor and mutator functions to handle state and validation.

name: util
description: Contains generic helper functions

name: src/gestures/Distance.js
Distance
description: A Distance is defined as two inputs moving either together or apart.

name: constructor
description: Constructor function for the Distance class.

name: type
description: The type of the Gesture.

name: threshold
description: The minimum amount in pixels the inputs must move until it is fired.

name: start
description:
start() - Event hook for the start of a gesture. Initialized the lastEmitted gesture and stores it in the first input for reference.
events.

name: move
description:
Event hook for the move of a gesture. Determines if the two points are moved in the expected
direction relative to the current distance and the last distance.

unknown.tagValue: {Object | null} - Returns the distance in pixels between the two inputs.

params.name: inputs
params.description: The array of Inputs on the screen.

params.name: state
params.description: The state object of the current region.

return.description: Returns the distance in pixels between the two inputs.

name: src/gestures/Expand.js
Expand
description:
An Expand is defined as two inputs moving farther away from each other. This gesture does
not account for any start/end events to allow for the event to interact with the Pan and Pinch
events.

name: constructor
description: Constructor function for the Expand class.

name: type
description: The type of the Gesture.

name: src/gestures/Gesture.js
Gesture
description: The Gesture class that all gestures inherit from.

name: constructor
description: Constructor function for the Gesture class.

name: type
description: The generic string type of gesture ('expand'|'pan'|'pinch'|'rotate'|'swipe'|'tap').

name: id
description:
The unique identifier for each gesture determined at bind time by the state object. This
allows for distinctions across instance variables of Gestures that are created on the fly
(e.g. Tap-1, Tap-2, etc).

name: setType
description: Set the type of the gesture to be called during an event

params.name: type
params.description: The unique identifier of the gesture being created.

name: getType
description: getType() - Returns the generic type of the gesture

return.description: The type of gesture

name: setId
description: Set the id of the gesture to be called during an event

params.name: id
params.description: The unique identifier of the gesture being created.

name: getId
description: Return the id of the event. If the id does not exist, return the type.

name: update
description: Updates internal properties with new ones, only if the properties exist.

name: start
description: start() - Event hook for the start of a gesture

params.name: inputs
params.description: The array of Inputs on the screen

return.description: Default of null

name: move
description: move() - Event hook for the move of a gesture

params.name: inputs
params.description: The array of Inputs on the screen

params.name: state
params.description: The state object of the current region.

return.description: Default of null

name: end
description: end() - Event hook for the move of a gesture

params.name: inputs
params.description: The array of Inputs on the screen

return.description: Default of null

name: src/gestures/Pan.js
Pan
description:
A Pan is defined as a normal movement in any direction on a screen. Pan gestures do not
track start events and can interact with pinch and expand gestures.

name: constructor
description: Constructor function for the Pan class.

params.name: options
params.description: The options object.

params.name: options.numInputs
params.description: Number of inputs for the Pan gesture.

params.name: options.threshold
params.description:
The minimum number of pixels the input
has to move to trigger this gesture.

name: type
description: The type of the Gesture.

name: numInputs
description:
The number of inputs to trigger a Pan can be variable, and the maximum number
being a factor of the browser.

name: threshold
description: The minimum amount in pixels the pan must move until it is fired.

name: start
description:
start() - Event hook for the start of a gesture. Marks each input as active, so it can invalidate any end
events.

name: move
description:
move() - Event hook for the move of a gesture. Fired whenever the input length is met,
and keeps a boolean flag that the gesture has fired at least once.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} - Returns the distance in pixels between the two inputs.

params.name: inputs
params.description: The array of Inputs on the screen

params.name: state
params.description: The state object of the current region.

return.description: Returns the distance in pixels between the two inputs.

name: end
description:
end() - Event hook for the end of a gesture. If the gesture has at least fired once, then it
ends on the first end event such that any remaining inputs will not trigger the event until
all inputs have reached the touchend event. Any touchend->touchstart events that occur
before all inputs are fully off the screen should not fire.

unknown.tagValue: {null} - null if the gesture is not to be emitted, Object with information otherwise.

params.name: inputs
params.description: The array of Inputs on the screen

return.description: null if the gesture is not to be emitted, Object with information otherwise.

name: src/gestures/Pinch.js
Pinch
description:
An Pinch is defined as two inputs moving closer to each other. This gesture does
not account for any start/end events to allow for the event to interact with the Pan and Pinch
events.

name: constructor
description: Constructor function for the Pinch class.

name: type
description: The type of the Gesture.

name: src/gestures/Rotate.js
Rotate
description: A Rotate is defined as two inputs moving about a circle, maintaining a relatively equal radius.

name: constructor
description: Constructor function for the Rotate class.

name: type
description: The type of the Gesture.

name: move
description:
move() - Event hook for the move of a gesture. Obtains the midpoint of two the two inputs and
calculates the projection of the right most input along a unit circle to obtain an angle.
This angle is compared to the previously calculated angle to output the change of distance,
and is compared to the initial angle to output the distance from the initial angle to the
current angle.

unknown.tagValue: {null} - null if this event did not occur
{Object} obj.angle - The current angle along the unit circle

{Object} obj.distanceFromOrigin - The angular distance travelled from the initial right
most point.

{Object} obj.distanceFromLast - The change of angle between the last position and
the current position.

params.name: inputs
params.description: The array of Inputs on the screen

params.name: state
params.description: The state object of the current listener.

return.description:
obj.distanceFromLast - The change of angle between the last position and
the current position.

name: src/gestures/Swipe.js
Swipe
description:
A swipe is defined as input(s) moving in the same direction in an relatively increasing velocity
and leaving the screen at some point before it drops below it's escape velocity.

name: constructor
description: Constructor function for the Swipe class.

params.name: options
params.description: The options object.

params.name: options.numInputs
params.description:
The number of inputs to trigger a Swipe can be variable,
 and the maximum number being a factor of the browser.
 move and current move events.

params.name: options.maxRestTime
params.description: The maximum resting time a point has between it's last

params.name: options.escapeVelocity
params.description: The minimum velocity the input has to be at to emit a swipe.

params.name: options.timeDistortion
params.description: (EXPERIMENTAL) A value of time in milliseconds to distort between events.

params.name: options.maxProgressStack
params.description:
(EXPERIMENTAL)The maximum amount of move events to keep
track of for a swipe.

name: type
description: The type of the Gesture

name: numInputs
description:
The number of inputs to trigger a Swipe can be variable, and the maximum number being
a factor of the browser.

name: maxRestTime
description: The maximum resting time a point has between it's last move and current move events.

name: escapeVelocity
description:
The minimum velocity the input has to be at to emit a swipe. This is useful for determining
the difference between
a swipe and a pan gesture.

name: timeDistortion
description:
(EXPERIMENTAL) A value of time in milliseconds to distort between events. Browsers do not accurately
measure time with the Date constructor in milliseconds, so consecutive events sometimes
display the same timestamp but different x/y coordinates. This will distort a previous time
in such cases by the timeDistortion's value.

name: maxProgressStack
description:
(EXPERIMENTAL) The maximum amount of move events to keep track of for a swipe. This helps give a more
accurate estimate of the user's velocity.

name: move
description:
Event hook for the move of a gesture. Captures an input's x/y coordinates and the time of
it's event on a stack.

unknown.tagValue: {null} - Swipe does not emit from a move.

params.name: inputs
params.description: The array of Inputs on the screen.

params.name: state
params.description: The state object of the current region.

return.description: Swipe does not emit from a move.

name: end
description:
Determines if the input's history validates a swipe motion. Determines if it did not come to
a complete stop (maxRestTime), and if it had enough of a velocity to be considered
(ESCAPE_VELOCITY).

unknown.tagValue: {null|Object} - null if the gesture is not to be emitted, Object with information otherwise.

params.name: inputs
params.description: The array of Inputs on the screen

return.description: null if the gesture is not to be emitted, Object with information otherwise.

name: src/gestures/Tap.js
Tap
description: A Tap is defined as a touchstart to touchend event in quick succession.

name: constructor
description: Constructor function for the Tap class.

params.name: options
params.description: The options object.

params.name: options.minDelay
params.description:
The minimum delay between a touchstart and
touchend can be configured in milliseconds.

params.name: options.maxDelay
params.description:
The maximum delay between a touchstart and
touchend can be configured in milliseconds.

params.name: options.numInputs
params.description: Number of inputs for the Tap gesture.

params.name: options.tolerance
params.description: The tolerance in pixels a user can move.

name: type
description: The type of the Gesture.

name: minDelay
description:
The minimum amount between a touchstart and a touchend can be configured in milliseconds.
The minimum delay starts to count down when the expected number of inputs are on
the screen, and ends when ALL inputs are off the screen.

name: maxDelay
description:
The maximum delay between a touchstart and touchend can be configured in milliseconds.
The maximum delay starts to count down when the expected number of inputs are on
the screen, and ends when ALL inputs are off the screen.

name: numInputs
description:
The number of inputs to trigger a Tap can be variable, and the maximum number being
a factor of the browser.

name: tolerance
description:
A move tolerance in pixels allows some slop between a user's start to end events. This
allows the Tap gesture to be triggered more easily.

name: start
description: Event hook for the start of a gesture. Keeps track of when the inputs trigger the start event.

unknown.tagValue: {null} - Tap does not trigger on a start event.

params.name: inputs
params.description: The array of Inputs on the screen.

return.description: Tap does not trigger on a start event.

name: move
description:
Event hook for the move of a gesture. The Tap event reaches here if the user
starts to move their input
before an 'end' event is reached.

unknown.tagValue: {null} - Tap does not trigger on a move event.

params.name: inputs
params.description: The array of Inputs on the screen.

params.name: state
params.description: The state object of the current region.

return.description: Tap does not trigger on a move event.

name: end
description:
Event hook for the end of a gesture.
Determines if this the tap event can be fired if the delay and tolerance
constraints are met. Also waits for all of the inputs to be off the screen before determining
if the gesture is triggered.

unknown.tagValue:
{null|Object} - null if the gesture is not to be emitted, Object with information
otherwise. Returns the interval time between start and end events.

params.name: inputs
params.description: The array of Inputs on the screen.

return.description:
null if the gesture is not to be emitted, Object with information
otherwise. Returns the interval time between start and end events.
